entities.description: "Pengda Qin is an author of the paper on DSGAN, affiliated with Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, China."
"Weiran Xu is an author of the paper on DSGAN, affiliated with Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, China."
"William Yang Wang is an author of the paper on DSGAN, affiliated with University of California, Santa Barbara, USA."
"Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications is an institution in China where Pengda Qin and Weiran Xu are affiliated."
"University of California, Santa Barbara is an institution in the USA where William Yang Wang is affiliated."
"DSGAN refers to the Generative Adversarial Training for Distant Supervision Relation Extraction, the main topic of the paper."
"New York Times dataset is a widely used dataset mentioned in the paper for evaluating the performance of relation extraction models."
"Natural Language Processing is a field where relation extraction is a crucial task, with applications in information retrieval, question answering, and knowledge base completion."
"Relation extraction is the process of predicting relations between entity pairs in a sentence, which is central to the paper's focus on DSGAN."
"Distant supervision is a method to generate relational data from plain text for unseen relations, which is discussed in the context of its noise labeling problem."
"Noise labeling problem refers to the issue of incorrect labels in distant supervision training samples, which impedes the performance of relation extraction."
"False positive samples are instances in the dataset that are incorrectly labeled as positive, a key issue addressed by the DSGAN framework."
"True positive samples are correctly labeled positive instances in the dataset, which the DSGAN framework aims to identify and preserve."
"Adversarial learning is the approach used in DSGAN to obtain a sentence-level generator that can recognize true positive samples from the noisy distant supervision dataset."
"Generative Adversarial Networks inspire the DSGAN framework, where the generator produces positive samples used as negative samples to train the discriminator."
"Sentence-level noise reduction is the strategy proposed in the paper to reduce noise in distant supervision datasets, which is more effective than bag-level noise reduction."
"Plug-and-play technique refers to the model-agnostic nature of the proposed method, which can be used with any relation extractors."
"Zelenko et al., 2003 is a reference to prior work in the field of relation extraction, cited in the paper."
"Bunescu and Mooney, 2005 is a reference to prior work in the field of relation extraction, cited in the paper."
"GuoDong et al., 2005 is a reference to prior work in the field of relation extraction, cited in the paper."
"Xian et al., 2017 is a reference to work on few-shot learning and zero-shot learning, cited in the paper."
"Mintz et al., 2009 is a reference to the initial work on distant supervision, cited in the paper."
"Hoffmann et al., 2011 is a reference to work on distant supervision, cited in the paper."
"Surdeanu et al., 2012 is a reference to work on distant supervision, cited in the paper."
"Roth et al., 2013 is a reference to work that discusses the performance impediment due to noise labeling problem, cited in the paper."

relationships.description: "Pengda Qin is one of the authors of the paper introducing DSGAN."
"Weiran Xu is one of the authors of the paper introducing DSGAN."
"William Yang Wang is one of the authors of the paper introducing DSGAN."
"The institution is affiliated with authors who introduced DSGAN."
"The institution is affiliated with an author who introduced DSGAN."
"DSGAN's performance is evaluated using the New York Times dataset."

entities.description: "DSGAN is the name of the method proposed in the paper for detecting true positive samples from a noisy distant supervision dataset."
"Riedel et al., 2010 are the authors of the Reidel dataset, which is a commonly-used distant supervision relation extraction dataset."
"Freebase is a huge knowledge base that includes billions of triples, used in the context of the paper for relation extraction tasks."
"The New York Times corpus is the source of sentences for entity pairs selected from Freebase."
"The Stanford named entity recognizer is used to recognize entity mentions in the NYT corpus."
"Finkel et al., 2005 are associated with the Stanford named entity recognizer."
"Lin et al., 2016 are the authors of the released word embedding matrix used in the paper."
"Santos et al., 2015 are referenced in the paper for their work on relation classification using CNN."
"Qin et al., 2017 are also referenced for their work related to CNN in relation classification."
"The Reidel dataset is a commonly-used distant supervision relation extraction dataset created by Riedel et al., 2010."
"NA is a special relation indicating no relationship between head and tail entities according to Freebase."
"/business/person/company is one of the relation types used as an example in the training process of DSGAN."
"/people/person/place lived is another relation type from the people class of Reidel dataset used in the training process."
"/location/neighborhood/neighborhood of is a relation type from the location class used to illustrate the training process."
"B represents a set of bags used in the adversarial training process, each containing instances of relation types."
"N^D represents the negative set used to calculate the accuracy of the discriminator in the adversarial learning process."
"P represents the noisy DS positive dataset from which new positive datasets are generated."
"B^1, B^2, ... B^N are individual bags within the set B, each containing instances for a relation type."

relationships.description: "DSGAN uses Freebase as the source of triples for the distant supervision relation extraction task."
"DSGAN uses sentences from the New York Times corpus to work with entity pairs from Freebase."
"The Stanford named entity recognizer is used on the New York Times corpus to identify entity mentions."
"DSGAN utilizes the word embedding matrix released by Lin et al., 2016 in its model."
"DSGAN is evaluated using the Reidel dataset for its distant supervision relation extraction capabilities."
"DSGAN is designed to handle entity pairs with the NA relation, indicating no relationship according to Freebase."
"DSGAN is trained using the /business/person/company relation type as an example."
"DSGAN is trained using the /people/person/place lived relation type as an example."
"DSGAN is trained using the /location/neighborhood/neighborhood of relation type as an example."

entities.description: "The Generator is a component in the adversarial learning process, designed to generate true positive samples for a relation type."
"The Discriminator is part of the adversarial learning process, competing with the Generator to improve the recognition of true positive samples."
"The Adversarial Learning Process is a strategy used to detect true positive samples from a noisy distant supervision dataset, involving a Generator and a Discriminator."
"The Distant Supervision Dataset is a dataset used in the adversarial learning process, which contains noise that needs to be filtered out."
"Relation Type refers to the specific type of relationship for which the Generator is designed to generate true positive samples."
"Policy Gradient Strategy is used to update the generator in the adversarial learning process, corresponding to the terminology of reinforcement learning."
"In the context of adversarial learning, 'state' refers to $s_{j}$, which is part of the reinforcement learning terminology."
"Policy in the adversarial learning context refers to $P_{G}(s_{j})$, aligning with the reinforcement learning framework."
"Reward $r$ is a concept in the adversarial learning process, defined from two angles to reflect the quality of the generator."
"Generated Sample Set refers to the set of samples generated by the generator, which is used to calculate the first component of the reward."
"Confidence is related to the discriminator's ability to identify positive samples from the Generated Sample Set."
"Prediction Probability is used to calculate the second component of the reward, based on the average prediction probability of $N^{D}$."
"Epoch refers to a full iteration over the dataset in the context of processing the bag $B_{i}$ in the adversarial learning process."
"Bag $B_{i}$ represents a set of data used in the adversarial learning process, particularly when calculating the reward $r_{2}$."
"The Generator is used as a Binary Classifier to filter noise samples from the distant supervision dataset."
"Entity Pair refers to a set of entities with annotated sentences that are evaluated by the generator to determine if they should be redistributed into the negative set."
"Annotated Sentences are sentences associated with an Entity Pair that are used to determine if the pair should be considered a false negative by the generator."
"Negative Set is the set into which an Entity Pair is redistributed if all its annotated sentences are determined as false negatives by the generator."
"True Positive Samples are the samples that the adversarial learning process aims to detect from the noisy distant supervision dataset."
"Noisy Samples are the incorrect or irrelevant samples in the distant supervision dataset that the adversarial learning process aims to filter out."
"True Negative refers to the samples that are correctly identified as not belonging to the relation type by the generator."
"False Negative refers to the samples that are incorrectly identified as not belonging to the relation type by the generator."
"False Positive refers to the samples that are incorrectly identified as belonging to the relation type by the generator."
"Accuracy $ACC_{D}$ is a measure computed on $N^{D}$ with the current $\theta_{D}$, indicating the performance of the discriminator."
"$\theta_{D}$ represents the parameters for the discriminator in the adversarial learning process."

relationships.description: "The Generator is a key component in the Adversarial Learning Process, responsible for generating samples."
"The Discriminator is another key component in the Adversarial Learning Process, competing against the Generator."
"The Generator is used to filter noise samples from the Distant Supervision Dataset."
"The Adversarial Learning Process is applied to the Distant Supervision Dataset to detect true positive samples."

entities.description: "DSGAN is the organization or project responsible for developing the described generator and discriminator models for sampling from a probability distribution."
"The Generator is a component of the DSGAN system, responsible for producing a set of probability distribution and sampling sentences based on that distribution."
"The Discriminator is a component of the DSGAN system, tasked with distinguishing between high-confidence and low-confidence samples generated by the Generator."
"Discrete GANs refers to the event or process of training the generator and discriminator in a discrete manner, as described in the text."
"An Epoch in this context is defined as one complete scanning of the entire DS positive dataset, which is a part of the training process for the models."
"Adversarial Training is the event or process where the generator and discriminator are alternatively trained towards their respective objectives in the DSGAN system."
"Policy-gradient-based Reinforcement Learning is the event or process used to optimize the generator's parameters, as it involves a discrete sampling step."
"The DS positive dataset is a collection of samples used for training the generator and discriminator within the DSGAN system."
"The probability of a sample being a true positive as defined by the generator, represented by the formula $p_{G}(s_{j})$."
"The probability of a sample being a true positive as defined by the discriminator, represented by the formula $p_{D}(s_{j})$."
"A Bag in the context of the DSGAN system refers to a subset of the DS positive dataset, used for training the generator and discriminator."
"Adversarial Learning is the concept underlying the training of the generator and discriminator, where they are alternatively trained towards their respective objectives."
"A sentence bag $B_{i}$ is a specific subset of sentences from the DS positive dataset used in the training process of the generator and discriminator."
"$T$ represents the set of sampled sentences generated by the generator based on the probability distribution, considered as true positive samples."
"$F$ represents the rest of the bag $B_{i}$ after removing the set $T$, treated as positive samples by the discriminator."
"$L_{G}$ is the objective function for the generator, which is to maximize the probability of the generated dataset $T$ being true positive samples."
"$L_{D}$ is the objective function for the discriminator, which is to minimize the cross-entropy loss function based on the samples treated as positive and negative."
"Gradient-based Algorithm is the method used to optimize the parameters of the discriminator in the DSGAN system."
"Pre-trained $\mathrm{G}$ refers to the generator model that has been pre-trained on the dataset $(P,\,N^{G})$ before the adversarial training process."
"Pre-trained $\mathrm{D}$ refers to the discriminator model that has been pre-trained on the dataset $(P,N^{D})$ before the adversarial training process."
"Adversarially trained generator G is the final output of the DSGAN system, a generator that has been trained through the adversarial process to produce high-confidence samples."

relationships.description: "DSGAN is responsible for the development and training of the Generator as part of their system."
"DSGAN is responsible for the development and training of the Discriminator as part of their system."
"The Generator and Discriminator are components of the DSGAN system that work together in the adversarial training process."
"The Generator is a key participant in the Discrete GANs process, responsible for sampling from a probability distribution."
"The Discriminator is a key participant in the Discrete GANs process, responsible for distinguishing between true positive and negative samples."
"An Epoch is a part of the Adversarial Training process, where the entire DS positive dataset is scanned once."
"The Generator's parameters are optimized through the process of Policy-gradient-based Reinforcement Learning."
"DSGAN utilizes the DS positive dataset for training the generator and discriminator."
"The Generator defines the probability $p_{G}(s_{j})$ for a sample to be a true positive."
"The Discriminator defines the probability $p_{D}(s_{j})$ for a sample to be a true positive."

entities.description: "DSGAN refers to a robust adversarial learning strategy used for distant supervision relation extraction."
"Zeng et al. (2015) are researchers who developed a model to solve the wrong labeling problem of distant supervision relation extraction."
"Lin et al. (2016) are researchers who developed a model to address the noise filtering in the sentence bag of entity pairs for distant supervision relation extraction."
"Riedel et al. (2010) are researchers associated with the Riedel dataset, which was manually inspected to find false positive cases in distant supervision relation extraction."
"Distant Supervision Relation Extraction is the process of extracting relations from data using distant supervision, which introduces noise in the labeled sentences."
"Generative Adversarial Training is the method proposed for robust distant supervision relation extraction, involving a generator and a discriminator."
"CNN+ONE is one of the recent state-of-the-art models used in the comparison to observe the improvement brought by the redistributed dataset."
"CNN+ATT is another state-of-the-art model used in the comparison to evaluate the performance improvement after applying the redistributed dataset."
"PCN+ONE is one of the models used in the comparison to assess the effectiveness of the redistributed dataset on improving distant supervision relation extraction."
"PCN+ATT is a model included in the comparison to determine the impact of the redistributed dataset on the performance of distant supervision relation extraction."
"Aggregate PR curves are used to represent the performance of different models, showing the improvement after applying the redistributed dataset."
"AUC value is a metric used to compare the performance of different models, reflecting the area under the PR curves."
"t-test evaluation is a statistical method used to determine the significance of the observed improvements in model performance."
"p-value is the result of the t-test evaluation, indicating the significance of the performance improvements observed."

relationships.description: "DSGAN is a method proposed to improve distant supervision relation extraction by using a generator and a discriminator in an adversarial learning process."
"Zeng et al. (2015) developed a model to address the wrong labeling problem in distant supervision relation extraction."
"Lin et al. (2016) developed a model to alleviate the influence of false positive samples in distant supervision relation extraction."
"The Riedel dataset from Riedel et al. (2010) was used to identify false positive cases in distant supervision relation extraction."

"Generative Adversarial Training is a method proposed to enhance the performance of distant supervision relation extraction by decreasing the performance of the discriminator while improving the generator."
"CNN+ONE is a model used to evaluate the performance in distant supervision relation extraction, showing improvement with the redistributed dataset."
"CNN+ATT is a model used in the evaluation of distant supervision relation extraction, demonstrating performance improvement with the redistributed dataset."
"PCN+ONE is a model used to assess the performance in distant supervision relation extraction, showing improvement with the redistributed dataset."
"PCN+ATT is a model used in the evaluation of distant supervision relation extraction, demonstrating performance improvement with the redistributed dataset."
"Aggregate PR curves are used to visually represent the performance of models in distant supervision relation extraction, indicating the improvement after using the redistributed dataset."
"AUC value is used to quantify the performance represented by the Aggregate PR curves, reflecting the area under the curves."
"t-test evaluation is used to determine the significance of the differences in AUC values, indicating the statistical relevance of the observed performance improvements."
"p-value is the output of the t-test evaluation, signifying the level of significance of the performance improvements observed."

"Mintz et al. are researchers who first aligned unlabeled text corpus with Freebase by distant supervision in 2009."
"Riedel et al. are researchers who adopted multi-instance single-label learning in relation extraction in 2010."
"Hoffmann et al. are researchers who modeled distant supervision relation extraction as a multi-instance multi-label problem in 2011."
"Surdeanu et al. are researchers who modeled distant supervision relation extraction as a multi-instance multi-label problem in 2012."

"Zeng et al. are researchers who proposed deep-learning-based models to solve relation extraction in 2014 and later proposed a method to select one most plausible sentence to represent the relation between entity pairs in 2015."
"Shen and Huang are researchers who proposed deep-learning-based models to solve relation extraction in 2016."
"Lin et al. are researchers who calculated a series of soft attention weights for all sentences of one entity pair and proposed a method to down-weight incorrect sentences in 2016."
"Ji et al. are researchers who brought the useful entity information into the calculation of the attention weights in 2017."
"Takamatsu et al. are researchers who built a noise-filtering strategy based on linguistic features extracted from many NLP tools in 2012."
"Cai and Wang are researchers who contributed to the understanding of GANs and their pre-training process in 2017."
"Wang et al. are researchers who contributed to the understanding of GANs and their pre-training process in 2017."
"Nguyen and Grishman are researchers who contributed to the understanding of sentence understanding using CNN in 2015."
"Im et al. are researchers who worked on generators applied in computer vision field in 2016."
"Freebase is a database that was aligned with unlabeled text corpus through distant supervision by Mintz et al."
"NER (Named Entity Recognition) is an NLP tool used for extracting linguistic features in noise-filtering strategies."

GANs (Generative Adversarial Networks) are a type of model used for adversarial learning, with pre-training being a common setting. They are used in the adversarial learning pipeline to obtain a robust generator for distant supervision relation extraction.
"CNN (Convolutional Neural Networks) are used to model both the generator and discriminator in DSGAN due to their performance in understanding sentences."
"The DS positive dataset is used for pre-training the discriminator and for the generator to overfit, aiming to collapse the discriminator."
"Adversarial Learning is the process where the generator and discriminator compete to improve their performance in DSGAN."
"The Policy Gradient Method is introduced to calculate gradients for the generator in the adversarial learning process."
"Distant Supervision is the technique used to label datasets with information from external knowledge bases, which can introduce noise."
"Relation Extraction is the process of identifying relationships between entities, which is the main focus of the research discussed in the text."
"Word Embedding is used to convert input instances into continuous real-valued vectors for relation extraction."
"Position Embedding is used alongside word embedding to convert input instances into continuous real-valued vectors for relation extraction."
